(i) 10 battalions two and a half cavalry regiments, 36 guns in Kandahar-Chaman area, (j) ,2 battalions, 2 guns spread along Seistan border, (k) At Herat 10 battalions two cavalry regiments and 24 guns. Some 15,000 tribesmen are reported to be with the forces at Rash id Kala and opposite Chaman.2. In the event of recommencement of hostilities the following is our proposed action : (1) Remaining on the active defensive on tho Ohitral border. The advance proposed in (2) will make VVakil Khan apprehensive of his communications with Jalalabad. (2) Advance on Basawal which should be occupied on 3rd day after receipt of orders to resume hostilities are aproved. The further advance to Jalalabad will follow as rapidly as possible. In view, however, of (a) the War Office delay to supply us with Mechanical Transport personnel which has been much depleted by sickness; (b) the continued delay in shipping the aeroplanes of the R.A.F. wings now in this country; (c) the great difficulties involved in operating in such trying con-ditions of climate ; ;(d) the necessity for the provision of ample transport to consolidate our position and to maintain troops comfortably as impressed 011 11 s in para. 2 of your telegram 2038, 23rd May; there may be a delay between occupation of Basawal and the advance to Jalalabad ; (e) a simultaneous advance against Nadir Khan at Matun. All arrangements have been made for this and Khost should be entered within four days after receiving orders to move. (.3) In north and south Waziristan we should (corrupt group) on the defensive. (4) On the Chaman front G.O.O., Baluchistan, has orders to have all his plans ready to attack Afghanistan forces in his vicinity and we should start the extension of the railway from Chaman so as to (corrupt group) Kandahar. (5) In East Persia we should remain on the defensive guarding against raids on our lines of communications and protecting Khorassan from Afghan or Bolshevic incursion.
